isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1991) - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS PROCEDURES FOR - ...EXCESSIVE EXHAUST SMOKE

step1.para: Excessive visual smoke can occur under two separate general conditions:

Excessive visual exhaust smoke can be caused by improper operation of the vehicle. For example, the driver must keep the engine speed within the specified RPM range for the transmission and rear axle ratio.
Diagnosis of this problem is critical.

step2.para: Check the air induction system and air cleaner restriction.
Inspect the cooling system; overcooling can cause blue smoke.
Excessive lube oil consumption can also cause blue smoke.
Constant gray smoke can be caused by poor injection nozzle condition or the air induction system. Refer to Section 5 for test procedures.
BLACK SMOKE - must be immediately corrected. All areas of appropriate "PERFORMANCE ANALYSIS GUIDE" (CGED-440- *) must be investigated to determine the cause.

item.para: If the problem cannot be resolved by analysis, remove the injection pump for a test stand analysis.
Excess fuel on starting with insufficient cranking speed.

step2.para: These conditions result in misfiring with warm engine.

step1.para: In general, any excess smoke problem can be resolved by following the procedures in the appropriate "PERFORMANCE ANALYSIS GUIDE", CGED-440-*.

svcsubproc.title: A. EVALUATING NORMAL EXHAUST SMOKE - VISUAL

item.para: At engine start up at all engine temperatures and at all ambient temperatures.
At low idle speeds after cold engine start up - this smoke will clear up soon after the vehicle is driven.
After the engine warm up period due to extended idling time (ten minutes or more).
When pulling hard, such as going up a steep grade.
Heavily loaded, such as pulling a trailer or operating with a heavy load in the truck bed.

note.para: Black smoke under the above conditions will be much more pronounced at higher altitudes. High altitude fuel adjustment instructions are available through Navistar dealers in those areas.

important.para: DO NOT OPERATE ENGINE ABOVE RATED SPEED.

note.para: "Black smoke of 60% opacity or more peak smoke is judged to exceed emission standards.

svcsubproc.title: B. EXCESSIVE WHITE SMOKE DURING COLD START.
svcsubproc.para: Glow plug continuity - If not OK, refer to "SOLID STATE GLOW PLUG TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE" CGED - 470-*.
